g.text: Boomlet will share its `boomlet_0_identity_pubkey` with Iso
Iso will share `boomlet_0_identity_pubkey`via a qr code on its monitor
ST will receive the key and store it
ST will create a keypair consisting of `st_0_identity_privkey`
ST will create a shared key:
ST will share its `st_0_identity_pubkey` via a QR code
Iso will decode the QR code and send it to Boomlet
Boomlet will receive the key and store it
Boomlet will create the shared key and store it permanently:
Boomlet will create a random array of numbers between 1 nad 198 inclusive:
ST will decode and decrypt the received message:
ST will assign a country to any of the numbers in the randomly sorted array
corresponding to its alphabetical rank and will show this array to the user for
("Choose 5 countries that will constitute your consent set. The order does not matter.")
User will select 5 countries via the ST's joystick. ST will record the index in the `randomly_sorted_duress_array`
User is to memorize the name of 5 countries that they have selected in this stage
ST will encrypt the newly received data and drop redundant data:
Boomlet will decrypt the received message:
Boomlet will search for the newly received indices in `randomly_sorted_duress_array`
store those numbers corresponding to aforementioned indices as `duress_consent_set`, and drop redundant data
Boomlet will make sure the user has memorized `duress_consent_set`.
For this, boomlet will create 5 randomly ordered set of numbers
between 1 and 198 inclusive and encrypt the container collection with
ST will decrypt the received message:
ST will assign a country to each of the 5 sets retrieved
after decryption in the previous manner and show 5 columns
to the user on its monitor.
User will select 1 country from each column shown on the ST
Boomlet will decrypt the received message:
Boomlet will search for the indices in `temp_test_duress_message_collection` and
if the resulting 5 numbers corresponding to the aforementioned indices, constitute
the same set as the `duress_consent_set`, boomlet knows that the user has "memorized"
If not, there would be a retry from
If that also fails, the duress setup process will start from
If all is good, Boomlet will drip the redundant data.
